intro: Senecio bachmannii, commonly known as Bachmann's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
